Not a bad place for the price, room was fair and clean. We went to check out Disneyland for two days and it was about 3 miles or so from the park. Didn't mind the drive to the park, the staff was friendly and had our reservations ready to go when we got there and checked us in promptly.  If you don't mind about a 15 minute drive to get to the park this place is great for the room rate!
Manager Response: Dear Patrick -  Thank you for taking a few moments to provide your review. We are happy to hear that our location and rates provided a great value for your Disneyland vacation. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The price of the hotel is awesome. the room was not too bad it had some burn marks on the comforter on the bed but other than that it was a pretty good stay.  If you do stay at this location go to sleep at 10 if you go to sleep earlier you will hear the fireworks sometimes sirens from the street  but it seems that it quiets down at 10pm.
Manager Response: Dear Aaron,  It is always wonderful to receive feedback from our guests. Thank you for your detailed review and for choosing Motel 6 Anaheim - Buena Park. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our clean and comfortable accommodations all at an affordable price!  Should you be in the area again we hope you stop by to visit again!

The pool area needs improvement and someone needs to seriously clean the dog poo in your little dog area. The staff were pretty friendly and based of how well kept the reception area was. I figured the rooms would be too. Once we arrived to our room. It reaked of smoke. The room itself was ok. It wasn't completely remodeled but it was pretty well kept and most importantly clean!!! But still the room stunk horribly of smoke. We asked for another room and sure enough it stunk too.

I visited the hotel in September 2015. I booked a nonsmoking room. As expected my room had a nonsmoking sign. But as soon as I entered the room everything was smelling like in an old smoky bar. Especially the bed and the curtains were smelling like hell. Never ever again!

The front desk is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very relaxing and gives you a at home kind of feeling.Also have a microwave and refrigerator.They are dog friendly no matter what size and have a dog area. Never seen any bugs here ever.

My experience as Travelodge was fantastic!!!!!!!.......and already wrote a review of this property........As Motel 6...... I know nothing of it and cannot write a review, as other reviewers seem to have had a bad experience which I did not encounter

Last minute trip booked her for something cheaper. The rooms here have not been redone yet as it use to be a Travelodge. Plus items microwave, Refrigerator, good WiFi, TV had direct TV was good quality quite a few channels HBO and Cinemax. Rooms were big did not have carpet which was nice. The room itself was clean and the outside was kept nice nothing special. The minus items. Not sure how the vent for the exhaust fans in the bathrooms are connected but you could smell smoke sometimes from other rooms that allowed smoking. One time it was someone smoking Marijuana. Management might want to clarify what a smoking room allows. Not sure if they are ok with people smoking Marijuana in the rooms. It is a descent budget motel but you need to remember when booking it is low budget.

We stayed here for one night, after the Days Inn @ Disneyland Park we were staying at had no rooms left on Friday night. I would not stay here again. While we had paid under $70/night at the Days Inn, we paid $99 here for a significantly smaller and lower quality room, impersonal service, vastly inferior television quality and number of channels, and a giant bug (cockroach?) in the bathroom when we arrived. In addition, the Days Inn had a microwave, fridge, served continental breakfast, and provided a free shuttle to Disneyland.

This property is no longer a Traveloge it has been taken over by Motel 6. For the cost, this is a very good deal for the OC. Not in the best of neoghborhoods vut you can safely walk from the hotel to any of the surrounding stores. VERY close to Disneyland, Knotts and Medieval Times. A block from CVS and less than a mile from Walmart grocery market. This location was recently updated/remodeled so soon it should completely wonderful.

Just a very basic hotel but close to Disneyland.  We found the hotel and room very clean and the staff very friendly.  Free breakfast was nothing to brag about.  Not many protein, if any, items to choose from.  Very easy walk to Disneyland and even a shorter walk to the tram.  I would definitely stay here again.

It was good location for goingt o Knotts Berry farm. Only issue is on the first night stay we did see a large roach scurry across the fridge. By the time my fiance went to kill it we were unable to find it. ALso the Office was being renovated and so was some of the rooms so it was noisy.
Clean...easy check-in/out etc. Clean rooms. had mini-fridge/coffe maker and microwave. Nice for trips to parks in area.

I read reviews, and was a little worried. I ended up being surprised. It was clean, the beds were comfy, the room was smell free. The bathroom had some wear to it, but no worse than the average bathroom. A mile from knotts, midevil times, and pirates. About 3 miles from Disneyland. Easy drive. I remember reading that the staff wasn't nice... They were very nice. I had no issues at all,and they answered my questions just fine.the breakfast was very very basic, cereal, milk, coffee juice and pasteries... I like cereal so I was contempt. Free food is free food.

Overall, this hotel was a good value.  Very close to Knotts Berry Farm and not to far from Disney.  The front desk called us after we checked in to see if we needed anything,  We needed an extra towel and pillow.  The only downside were the beds were very hard, which made for restless nights.  The hotel grounds were quiet and clean.  I have recommended this hotel to family already and would stay here again if I was visiting Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Travelodge in Anaheim on South Beach

Breakfast comes with the room but not many choices also we found that some cartons of milk already over use by date inside the fridge. The hotel was older but clean and quiet.  We stayed on Tuesday through Thursday and it was not busy, as it was after Labor Day.  The room was spacious.  This is a older budget motel, but we got what we were expecting after reading the reviews.  There was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. The furniture and carpet were older, but everything was clean. Breakfast was waffles, toast and cereal.  It is a half mile walk along a busy road to the parking lot where you catch the free shuttle to Disneyland.  We had no problem walking, as there are sidewalks and traffic lights at the intersections.  No charge for parking.  It is not a luxurious Disney hotel, but the price was good.

The hotel staff was very nice. I have no complaints about that. The room on the other hand could have been better. Could have been a little bit cleaner. It was ok for one night stay. I would not stay longer though not for $120 a night. The bed we had on the second floor was comfortable.

Maid service was missed one day and when I talked to the front desk about it for some reason she cancelled the following day as well as I discovered when I talked to someone at the front desk at 5:00PM about why there wasn't room service for the second day.

I paid for the room but did not stay in it.
Handy to most things and value for money. Not the ritz but clean and the room I had was recently updated. Had a refridgerater , microwave , and as I said good value for money

The room was a little smelly, we bought fabreez to mask the odor. Full of kids and pets. but serviceable.

I could hear every door close and every conversation throughout the entire hotel most of it in Spanish while I had the air on full blast and the tv on. Worst stay ever!

Summary Heading: Just what I needed for low-budget hotel
Summary: I'm reviewing this hotel based on the fact it was $50/night for weekend dates when most hotels were $100+ in the area.  Very easy to find hotel, big sign, can't really miss it. Hotel is about 5 minutes from Knott's Berry's front gate, 15 minutes from Disneyland parking lot. There are plenty of gas stations, convenience stores, and restaurants nearby.  Front desk girl was friendly enough upon check-in, chatted about the weather, gave me my room key and the free wifi password. I was placed on the 3rd floor (I didn't see an elevator) all the way in the back of the property... which was a little sketchy. There's some older cars/taxis parked in the back that look like they've been there quite some time. Also seemed like possibly some rooms were being lived in like an apartment
ok for 2 star hotel. older hotel,rug could have been better vacuumed. bathroom was spotless,all amenities worked. free hbo. high carb 'breakfast'. aaa rated.

I woke up with a head-ache in the morning because of the smoking smell.   There was fungus in the complimentary breakfast. My daughter took half of the muffin that had fungus.  When we complained about it, the staff was not helpful. There was no sorry or apology, the front desk person just threw some muffin and replaced with new. But the new muffins also had fungus. After argument with the staff, they threw the whole muffin tray out.  Overall, it was a terrible experience.
Very good stay, very good staff, a special thanks to the manager to keep connecting rooms for our family (2 adultes and 4 kids)

The hotel was very nice.  The bed was very comfortable.  We even had a Jacuzzi tub in our room.  The only negative thing about our stay was when we went to fill the tub there was weird things floating in it.  However, when we drained it and refilled it, EVERYTHING WAS FINE!
We really enjoyed our stay especially because of the comfy bed and the jacuzzi tub. Thank you

Good and comfortable stay will recommend others Excellent for price paid for in LA. Staff services awesome.

This is one of the cheapest Wyndham hotels in North Orange County, but don't let that scare you away.  It was clean and comfortable and you can't beat it for the price.  Bed didn't have a plastic liner like most cheap hotels, it was very comfortable.  TV had lots of channels and a nice size.  Great location next to Knotts and lots of food options.

Summary Heading: Great "in room safe" but poor elevator
Summary: Upon arriving we waited over 10 min for the elevator before walking up the stairs and riding it down to pick up our bags. We never rode it again. The room itself could use some updating but we had plenty of space and we really appreciated the "in room safe". The building itself also could use some upkeep but the staff was helpful and friendly. The area was good and easy to get around and find things without going too far.

Summary Heading: Nice and clean enough, but unfortunately my room overlooked...
Summary: Nice and clean enough, but unfortunately my room overlooked the 8-lane main drag so it was very noisy.

We had to stay at a motel while my house was being fumigated for termites. The location worked well for us to get to work easily. The rooms are very plain, not at all attractive. Cheap furniture, leaky bath tub faucet, and a cigarette burn in the bedspread. Carpets need cleaning. But the staff was certainly friendly and the continental breakfast each morning was pretty good. All in all I'd say adequate for what we needed but I'd never come here for a vacation.

Most of the time I stay 2 or 3 times a year with family, it 's convenient and affordable, quiet and close to most every place i like to go .But breakfast area is very packed u better hurry and don't forget to ask for an extra toilet paper if u have family .

I'd needed to have a first floor, no stairs and that 1st floor room was waiting for me when I checked in. The staff was excellent. I had to call as I couldn't get my TV to work and that was immediately taken care of. I loved that I had free parking and free internet access! My only complaint is that there appeared to be some water damage in the bathroom, on the wall close to the floor near the tub, behind the toilet.

we have been comming to this location for the past 10 years. Eliza, the manager has always been very helpful to us and all the guests that stay at this location which is why we keep comming back to stay at this travelodge. It is in a good location. Right between disneyland and knotts.

Summary Heading: Ok Hotel, Bad Appearance and Location
Summary: The location and the appearance of the hotel was bad. Pictures on website is not what it actually looks like.

One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The overhead light in the room had a faulty shade that fell off; the room was infested with ants and fleas, and the bathroom hooks kept falling off with nails exposed. Too pricey for the low quality of the room.

When getting to the hotel it looked a little run down on the outside but once checking in they were very helpful and we were told about the complementary breakfast and free wifi. Clean. Friendly staff. Breakfast was not impressive but it wasn't really important. Ugly paint color combination in room, light blue with dark orange accent wall.

Summary Heading: It could have been a better stay.........
Summary: The hotel had power outage for the entire day. When we checked-in the night, we were handed with a flash light. What a "checked-in" special! Our room was dark, with no power and no hot water till 1 AM. When we woke up in the next morning, we found TV, WI-Fi were out of service due to the power outrage. We did not use any of the amenities from this hotel.  It was not pleasant stay and we our night was long and exhausted.

The carpet was damp and smelled of mildew. The sink faucet was broken. The bath mat had mildew. The outside corridors were dirty. The elevator walls were smudged with dirt. The desk staff was courteous however, we will not return.

The overall value was great.  The breakfast was meager but what I would expect from a basic continental breakfast.  The Wi-Fi was horrible, would not stay connected.  Although I heard terrible things about the neighborhood we never had nor saw any problems.

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff who helped in every way. The room was...
Summary: Very friendly staff who helped in every way. The room was average, needs remodel as the furniture was old and worn out. The door was dirty and made me not want to touch it

My wife and I stayed there last January for 2 weeks. In this hotel was good: - Staff (was friendly and helpfull) - Fast check-in/out - Location (very good 7 minutes to Disney) - Price  - spacious room - hot water all time  Was bad: - need to remodel the rooms. The furniture is very old and it has horrible tv - Carpets are dirty - ant in rooms  The cost / benefit was good.
I had requested a non-smoking room and was given a "non-smoking" room that  reeked of smoke.  The second room was a little better, but very noisy.  Both rooms needed cleaning.

Summary Heading: Hotel needs to hurry up with the remodeling being done...
Summary: Hotel needs to hurry up with the remodeling being done.  Rooms were shabby looking, and I wore socks the whole time I was in the room.  Carpets are very dirty.
My family and I stood here for the weekend and we loved the spacious and clean room we were in. It was close to everything we needed.
did get a good night sleep here.  room was smelly even with the air cond running.  worse than some motel i stayed at before.  would not come back here if i can help it.

My husband & I stayed here with our kids (8yr old & 5yr old) last December.  Our room was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly.  We arrived in the middle of the night and Opree (or Ofree) checked us in quickly and made us feel very welcomed.  It was very late,  we just wanted to get to our room & sleep, so were thankful for his fast & efficient work.  This was a little  ways from Disney but no biggie for us, it was close enough to Disney & Knotts. We loved that it offered free breakfast,  anything free in Anaheim's overpriced economy is very much appreciated!  It's not gourmet but its free & lots of choices for the whole family.  We liked this place & will come back next time we go to Anaheim.

I cannot recommend this hotel enough.  I will admit the entrace is a turnoff (abondoned restaurant in front of property) but the rooms are large and CLEAN, the pool and spa were CLEAN and inviting, the breakfast was adequate, nothing great, but it was complimentary and staff was ALWAYS courteous, VERY knowledgeable about the area and restaurants and the nightly rate, while high (but not as high as some of the other area motels) was fair.  I would recommend to anyone I know.

Spent 5 days in. We liked the location, the price, clean outside and room, the nice and friendly staff,  the breakfast was OK if you consider it was not your 5 star Hotel. My only complain is that room dirty carpet that turns your feet into black!!!  Is it that expensive for them to clean that carpet?

The receptionist was fine, upon my complaining of having to pay a fee for the "expensive electronic rooom keys." The room is old looking and the TV is very difficult to operate. The shower was awful. horrible room smelled  nothing worked not even the phone    curtains torn   bathroom was disgusting
PROS: Location, quiet nights, good service, nice indoor heated pool.  CONS: creepy elevator, use of carpets, some  stained towels.

The faucet was so small in the sink that we couldnt rinse our hands off. We awakened for coffee, and found there was no coffee pot, that we must go to the office for coffee, staff saying in process of getting new coffee makers. The lady at checkout was also very pleasant.

Rooms - Good condition, smelled a little bit weather was nice, so windows open.. However, NEVER seen a hotel that requires payment upon check in! I've been working in hospitality industry over 10 years, this was first...  Location was good-  Continental breakfast was decent- They are very cheap when it comes to amenities... One soap and one shampoo upon check in... Also, they charge to use in-room safe $1.50 a day... WHAT??

I booked this Hotel because I had credits on my Wyndam card. Wish I would have stayed somewhere else! The people were very accommodating, but that,s about where it ends! It was on the 3rd floor, which was alright but it must have been a monthly rental room, which they offer. This should have been a clue, but that was not on the website! Room smelled, outdated furnishing, in a real questionable part of town. I find it hard to believe that the other people rating the Hotel stayed at this place and rate it so high! Never again! I will go to the Good Nite Inn!

Summary Heading: I was very pleased with the location, didn't expect much...
Summary: I was very pleased with the location, didn't expect much for breakfast but when we went downstairs i was very satisfied and surprised Will definitely in the future come back. And its military friendly thank you.

This hotel is dated but was clean and the room we had very spacious.  We had four people and all our camping gear and still had room to move around.  The beds were comfortable.  The showerhead was very low so might be a problem for taller people.

Summary Heading: Exactly what I wanted and expected
Summary: So I spent some time looking at the other reviews since I was going with my wife. Hotel seemd good with a very affordable rate which was important to us considering the area. We had a terrific stay. The customer service was great, and the front desk and housekeeping were always smiling and helpful. There was a nice breakfast and we found the items in room to be helpful esp the coffee maker for the long days of entertainment in Anaheim. We will definitely come back if we come to Anaheim again. Nice hotel, rooms and staff and good location. If price, location, service are important - this is a good option.

Summary Heading: Most restful experience at a motel!
Summary: I stayed at this motel recently while visiting Southern California to attend two of my cousins’ high school graduations on consecutive weeks.  I liked my experience at this motel so much the first time that I booked it again for my second trip.  I stayed in a different room each time and found on both occasions the rooms were clean, quiet and had many of the amenities of more expensive hotels.  This was by far one of the most pleasant and restful experiences I’ve ever had staying in a motel.  Before booking, I checked several other motels and Travelodge locations in the Anaheim area, and found this to be among the best in value for the money.  The friendly staff was very attentive and treated me like “family”.  I would definitely recommend this location!

Summary Heading: Best place for a cheap price
Summary: I always stay at expensive hotels and the last time I came to CA I stayed at the Knotts Berry Hotel it was over priced and very small rooms you could barley walk around. This time I decided for once to try a cheap hotel. My expectations were not very high since it was $57 a night. I was amazed how the staff was so friendly. When we checked into the room it was big and very clean. The beds were so comfortable. Even for the price I did not expect in room safe, microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. This was a very nice hotel. Even the cleaning service was great. We went to the beach and had so much sand in the tub and beds  when we came back it was all clean. They even gave us new sheets for the 2nd day which was great because with 2 young kids they spill stuff. I would recommend

The GM treated us like family members and hovered over the place like a mother hen wanting to make sure everything was ok, and it was. We live in hotels all over the world 360 days a year and it’s rare to feel like you are really at home but this staff made us feel at home quickly. Summary Heading: Frequent guest, but the beds are a little too soft
Summary: I enjoyed my stay (which was for a religious convention at the Anaheim Convention Center & Arena), but the beds need a a bit firming, like tempurpedic firm for those who have sciatica & back/muscle discomfort. The televisions in the rooms have recently been upgraded to flat screen :-), but the DirecTV receivers attached to them need to be upgraded to high definition signals for a stunning view possible, while maintaining costs. Everything elese is an A+ of a job!

Our stay at this hotel was wonderful. The service was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and well kept. The cleaning service was timely and efficient. The property was clean and attractive.

Summary Heading: Very convenient, inexpensive place to stay while visiting the amusement parks
Summary: Our family recently stayed two nights while on a trip to Knott's Berry Farm. The rates were great. It is very conveniently located, plenty of gas stations, fast food, etc all around. Great service from the staff. The complimentary continental breakfast was perfect for grabbing something quick on our way out. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Beds were clean and comfortable. There were mini fridges and microwaves in the rooms. It was perfect for our needs...actually better than expected considering we were not planning on spending much time in the rooms so we weren't expecting much. The younger boys even went in the heated pool in the morning despite it being around 45 degrees out! We would love to stay again!

The outside looks very shabby (as well as the neighbourhood and the people around), but the rooms are big and comfortable: TV, mini-fridge, coffee-maker, microwave, internet. Basic breakfast is also included. But the staff is the best thing the hotel has: they are very nice, friendly and helpful, specially the woman in the morning. It's not a place to spend your honeymoon, but it's definitely a good place to spend a decent night for a low price.
Front desk people are nice, helpful and quick service, especially Richmond and Eliza.
The room was great and the service was even better! Josna at the front desk has a way with attentiveness and professionalism that is hard to find

I was skeptical at first due to the reviews but Is not as bad as some people stated. Here are my negatives: no iron, pool was never heated and when we asked for the heater to be turned on the front desk guy got upset sent someone out to "turn it on" but they said it wasn't  working. We also got 3 towels when there were 4 of us. Positives: location, room cleaned daily, parking right in front of the room every day. Breakfast was decent juice, coffee,milk, cereal,bagels, muffins, and Danish  Overall, it was a pleasant stay and I would go again.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and the kind words about our hotel. We apologize and regret that we were not aware of the issues with the iron and towels as we could have remedied the situation promptly. We recently installed a brand new heater in our pool and the water temperature has been reset. We are confident that you will see a difference during your next visit. Thank you again for your feedback. We will review all of it with our team here at the hotel.

Summary: The rooms all have a musty, funky mold smell.  The carpets are filthy and so are the walls.  I killed two cockroaches (big ones) during our stay.  We were working nights down here, so had to sleep during the day, but the construction (drilling electrical conduit into the building and the concrete floors) was too much.  I understand they have to do it and most people sleep at night, that's fine.  I understand that.  But the drilling and sawing went on from 9am to 9pm.  That was a bit much.  Grossly disappointed in this hotel.
Manager Response: I appreciate the time you took for posting this review and I am sorry that you were disappointed with our hotel. I certainly understand the frustration you must have felt with the noisy construction period during your stay as we were in the process of upgrading our rooms, hall ways and landscaping. Please accept my sincere apologies. I will have Orkin Commercial Services, our contracted vendor for pest elimination, look into any pest issues. I will take your feedback regarding the condition of the rooms to our housekeeping team and use it as a training tool to make sure that our cleanliness standards are where they need to be. We always welcome the chance to improve and candid reviews like yours make that possible. I would very much like the opportunity to speak with you personally regarding your stay and understand more of the details involved. Again, I thank you for your posting. It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: I have been pleased with my stay at the Travelodge in Anaheim/Buena Park  My personal standards are pretty high.  And they complied with everything I have requested.  The Manager, Richmond Richardson is committed to not just maintaining, but improving the hotel everyday.  It's obvious.  I have talked with him personally.  If you have a problem, you let him know.  And he'll take care of it.  The hotel is best in class in the surrounding area.  The customer service is as good as it gets.  People like Eliza, Josna, Jose, Alonzo, Carlos, Rashid and Sudha?  They are angels.  They want to help you, they want you to have a nice stay, so much.  I can't speak for other guests prior to me or after me, but in my personal situation, today? They do right by me.  And I see them do right by

Summary Heading: Not a good feeling...just look around you
Summary: You have cameras facing your door., and I've had petty things stolen but didn't report it. I just won't stay again. Also  People hang out on the balcony, you are being watched as your entering and exiting your room. The cleaning lady still knocks your door, even there is a Do Not Disturb sign there!   If you want privacy and discretion don't stay here. Some of the hotel staff gossip about customers! So beware! Overall, the rooms are decent,  the sheets feel like paper. And a feeling of uneasyness that creeps over you. And the spa pool is not working there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. I apologize that we failed to meet your expectations, but we take all guest feedback very seriously and it is an important part of our continuous improvement process. Please know that our staff is addressing your observations as well as using some of your comments as a training tool. I would be happy to discuss your experience in more detail as it is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: We stayed in two rooms not near each other. So it wasn't a problem with just one part of the hotel. Every time we entered the rooms, we were greeted with a very overwhelming stuffy moldy smell. The bathroom was even worse. I think it was the shower curtain where the moldy smell was coming from. It was really really bad. The carpet was actually sticky at some places. I have stayed at some very cheap hotels like motel 6, etc. But this one is the worst of the hundreds of hotels I've stayed in. There was no coffee maker in one of the rooms, even though it was advertised. The neighborhood was ok, neither scary not great.
Manager Response: We appreciate your candor and comments. The situation with the smell and the carpet in your rooms is deeply regrettable. We take these notifications seriously. We are always looking for ways to upgrade our décor and improve the quality of our guestrooms to provide all of our guests a perfect stay. We apologize for the unfortunate occurrences. Your feedback will help us improve. We are addressing the issues and hope you have an opportunity to stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here, NOT even for the price
Summary: 1. Very low water pressure and cold at that.  Takes forever to brush teeth or wash hands. Had to us hand sanitizer to complete washing of the hands.  Forget about showering -no hot water either.  This should be a basic comodity with any hotel.  Apparently, here it isn't. 2. We chose this hotel based upon the "Indoor Heated Pool" advertisement. The pool is NOT heated and is partially indoors (like under an awning). When we asked about the heated pool, staff acted as if it was a lot of trouble to turn it on, but they said it would take 1.5 to 2hrs to heat. We checked after 3 hrs and still not heated.  Checked in the morning and still not heated. 3. Giving the $10 refundable room key deposit was not an issue.  But, when we checked out the girl at the desk acted as if she did not

My husband and I stayed here for one night so we could get an early start to Disney the following morning.  We usually stay closer to the Park but made our reservations fairly last minute and everything in walking distance was sold out....so we went for one of the cheaper, yet reputable branch, places we could find.  The pros:  Tons of free parking, an elevator from parking lot to upstairs, a covered pool (albeit a small one), air conditioner was very strong, bedding smelled fresh, mattress was comfortable, free wireless internet worked fine, fridge and microwave in room, table with 2 chairs, direct tv was nice, and the free breakfast was fresh (although the selection was only mini muffins and danishes, they were tasty).  The cons:  The carpet turned my socks fairly brown, the

Ok, not located in a great part of town and driving up I felt a little insecure as to what we would be staying in for four nights during my family's disneyland vacation. The following is our experience:  The staff were nice and informative during check in....as we arrived around 10:30pm I had to walk up to a teller like window and show id before they unlocked the office to let me in. Other than that, my check in was uneventful, but I worried about the room I had reserved for a great deal because it's a little scary in that neighborhood. But surprise, surprise! Upon opening the door to our room and switching on the lights I could hear a collective sigh of relief coming from all of us. The room was clean and charming with a fridge, microwave, table, safe, and decent sized. The
Manager Response: We are happy that you have found our hotel satisfactory. Regarding the pool and the curtains as well as the other items that were indicated in the review, please know that we are taking the needed measures for improvement. We want make sure that we are providing the best amenities and the best service to all of our guests. We want to thank you for bringing these up to us as it will give us a chance to improve. We hope you could stay with us again at our hotel.

Summary: During my visit to the torrance travelodge recommended this hotel for my visit to disneyland.  The staff was friendly, and the hotel is very clean.  The hotel has free breakfast , wifi and even a jacuzzi room making this a very comfortable  and enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: We are glad to have made your stay comfortable and enjoyable. We hope that we can have you again at our hotel.

Summary: Being a SoCal native, I needed to find a place to stay on a recent trip to Disneyland that would give me and my girlfriend a nice place to retreat but still be affordable.  We lucked out with the Travelodge Anaheim.    1) Location: Not only was it close to our premiere destination of Disneyland (a short trip on local streets got us there quickly), but it was also even closer to Knotts Berry Farm and downtown Buena Park, where we found tons of dining selections that were open relatively late.    2) Accommodations:  Spacious, clean, large bed, jacuzzi jet tub, mini-fridge and microwave, plus DirecTv!  Free wireless!  Free continental breakfast!  Free parking!    3) Service: The front desk attendant make checking in and finding our room very easy.  Also, check out was a breeeeze!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great remarks. We are very happy to have made your stay a great one. We take pride in the great service and free amenities that are available for our guests and we are glad this had made your stay more enjoyable. We hope we could have you again at our hotel. We hope on your next trip you could have a chance to enjoy our pool.

Summary: The place was a good deal for what we paid. We only stayed 2 nights and we didn't expect much of it, but overall the room was decent. The general cleanliness was doubtful - dirt stains on the bathroom door, worn out carpet and old furniture. But the bed sheets and towels were clean, the beds were comfy and everything in the room was functional: AC, TV, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, etc. The pressure of the hot water in the shower was low, but just enough to take a quick shower. Very simple breakfast (2 types of cereal, muffins and fruit, tea, coffee, orange juice and milk) but it's nice to be able to grab a bite in the morning. The staff were very, very friendly and helpful and that's a great plus for the hotel. You get what you paid for, which is not much, but remember

I have taken groups of students to this motel four times, for a total of about 50 rooms rented over the last 5 years.  The staff has always been accomodating, and none of my students or chaperones has complained about their rooms.  This is not the Hilton, but it is a good, clean motel with decent beds, a large sink area, adequate parking, and a great "indoor"  pool and hot tub, with pool towels.  Breakfast is simple and high-carb, with no protein as I remember, but I could be mistaken. Juice and coffee were good, pastries, cereal &  muffins fine. (Dennys is next door if you crave a cooked breakfast.) We've never had a noise or security problem. Late-night CVS drug store is 2 blocks away - a healthy walk, but not for women at night.

I got a very good rate and the service as usual was excellent. Whenever I am in the area I stay here and overall have had a good experience. The hotel was recently remodeled and had new furniture as well and this is an improvement over the first time I came here.  The staff is very cordial and friendly and has been the same staff I have seen each time I stay here. I would and have recommended this hotel to friends.

Summary Heading: will stay again next visit to california
Summary: The hotel is very nice and clean with new mattresses and new furniture.  The front office is very welcoming.  All the staff are warm and friendly.  They were really patient in giving us directions and info on what to do in the area since we have little kids.  It is about 5 miles away from disneyland but for the price that we paid and service that we got, it was worth every penny!      They have been doing renovation and I can't wait for our trip next year.  We plan to stay in this hotel over and over again.  And I'm sure that my family agrees with me too.

I was suppose to stay at this hotel, but in error we went to the other travelodge closer to the Convention Center, the reason for our trip.  When we found out the error and they told us that we were at the wrong hotel, the front desk at the new hotel sold us a room at their location, called the other hotel and told them to waive our cancel penalty as they had sold us a room.  We were assured this was done.  Afterwards, my credit card bill showed the charge for the cancellation at this hotel, that we were told would be waived since we stayed at a different Travelodge.    Well after repeated calls to the hotel to speak to the hotel manager (who is NEVER there), I finally got a call over 2 weeks later from her, to tell me that though she could reverse the charge, she was not going

Family of five in two rooms travelling from the Uk and just needed one night in this area. As ever, you get what you pay for. We just wanted somewhere to sleep before continuing our holiday and therefore it more than met our requirments. Rooms weren't too bad at all and up to the standard you would expect of Travelodge. If you want 5 star then book 5 star. The rooms were clean and spacious and the hotel staff we met were very friendly, helpful and polite. If you are looking for Travelodge type hotel in this area then it is worth considering. I would use it again.

This is not a place you should stay.  Simply put....it was gross!  Flies throughout our room.   What appeared to be a prostitute (beer in hand) walking up the stairs with what appeared to be her pimp(cuss words were flying).  She was hanging out again the next morning as we checked out.  The area is not the safest.  It's a rundown area of cheap motels.  I think you probably get the picture.  Continental breakfast was simple.  Two cereal choices, juice/milk/coffee, muffins and fruit.  Front desk staff were polite and friendly.  Avoid...especially if you have children.  Not safe.

Summary Heading: Horrible Hotel, don't let the other feedback trick you
Summary: No hot water in Shower Dirty Rooms Mildew Worn Rooms Worn Drapes Bad Service Misrepresentation  When I complained about my experience, the person in the office told me to deal with it. Shortly after another person complaining about similair issues. The staff was not responsive.  I suggest that you pay more money for a clean hotel. Don't be dissapointed.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: The hotel is OK. Stay away if you are a picky person, the rooms are old and very used, but the price is good if you just want a place to sleep after having fun in Disneyland. The shower was the only terrible thing, no pressure at all. And the breakfast is just coffee, orange juice and some muffins that didn't look tasty at all. But since you have a refrigerator and microwave just stop by Walmart and get you something better. I would recommend it, but remember you are getting what you paid for.
The good: Clean room, friendly staff. The not so good: a bit far from Disneyland but is still within a reasonable distance by bus. The staff will explain how to get there.

Visited as 2 adults and 3 children, for 8 days. Recommend for good value for cost.  Pro: 1. Very friendly staff and driver. 2. Drove family to disney park since shuttle had been cancelled. 3. Basic but clean and large room - 2 Queen beds. 4. Easy route to come and go if you have a rental car as we did for 2 days. 5. Convenient kid's heated inside pool - open 9 to 9, but they were flexible afer hours if asked.  Con: 1. The daily shuttle to Disney had been cancelled for a mysterious reason and was not relayed to us before arriving. 2. Not many choices of shopping or restaurants if walking from the Travelodge, just a couple of small strip malls a few blocks away. 3. Don't expect more breakfast than pastries/muffins and juice and coffee.

3 adults and 4 children made a last minute trip down to Disneyland over the President's Day weekend. Since we did not plan more than 2 weeks in advance, the motel we usually stay in across from the Main Gate of Disneyland had no rooms available. Since we are out of the room from 7:30 AM until late at night, we always look for a low cost, clean and safe motel. We ended up at the Anaheim-Buena Park Travelodge. Overall, OK in a pinch, but a few issues will keep me from staying there again. They advertised a "deluxe continental breakfast". I think the powdered creamer for the coffe was what they thought made it "deluxe" They had only coffee, orange juice, and small, boxed sugary pastries. No fruit or cereal or toast to be found. It was a 15-20 minute drive to the park. The parking

We booked this hotel on the internet. Pictures look great. Don't be fooled. They were remolding and putting new carpet and paint in rooms, however they needed new furniture. The room we stayed in was awful, stained carpet, filthy walls and the sink and counter were falling off the wall. We were suppose to stay for 4 days. We checked out the next day. The Hotel staff was very wonderful and kind. Maybe after the remodeling is done it will be suitable.

I reserved this room for two nights, after the first 30 minutes I was ready to take the loss and find a different hotel.  The room smelled terrible, the linens were extremely worn, and overall had the apperance of not being well kept.  The staff seemed friendly but when I returned after being gone for the day the room was exactly as I had left it.  they did not clean the room, no fresh towels, trash was not emptied, etc, etc.  My wife and I felt a bit unsure about the place and felt it was just best to leave. This hotel was booked through Priceline.com and my next contact will be to inform them how terrible our stay was even though Priceline had recommended this hotel.  I would never stay at this place again.

Summary Heading: Medium Quality for a Moderate Price
Summary: We had read the earlier reviews before booking and expected more, but overall weren't too disappointed, but we'll try to find something better next time.  The room was clean and the location was good for us, but the outside could look better and when people roll their suitcases along the concrete outdoor hallways, it feels and sounds like an earthquake.  This seemed to happen all times of the night too.  Not very quiet in other respects either.  Still, we've been in worse (and better).

We had a good, basic room for the price.  We stayed one night after coming from four nights at the Anaheim Hilton.  Our room (#301) was large with two queen beds, a full-sized computer desk, microwave and refrig--none of which our Concierge Level Hilton room had.  The bathroom was on the smallish side, with only one sink.  The room came with a Continental breakfast and a Los Angeles Times for 13 cents, which if you refused it, could be credited to your account.  The room was rather stark with bright, white walls and little artwork, but the front desk clerk, Octavio, was very friendly, and the housekeeping staff willingly gave us extra towels.  The indoor swimming pool looked very murky and cloudy.  Our room was on the top floor on the Beach Boulevard side, and there was a lot of

We booked our lodgings on the internet from South AFrica.  The internet says directly opposite Disney.  It is not directly opposite Disney.  It is 20 miles away !!  On arrival at the hotel - booking in - a real slime ball women [yes - one of those] came in to pay her daily rate.  We were absolutely floored.  The police cars were up and down in the parking lot - looking for I dont know what - and the entire experience at this hotel made us feel cheap and nasty.  The hotel did not have any bus time tables [one would think that it would come standard when dealing with tourists].    After coming into contact with the daily renters at reception - one was a little hesitant to sleep peacefully - not knowing what had slept on the bed before you.    Not a hotel I would reccomend to

The Travelodge on Beach is consistently the best bargain in Anaheim, and our first call whenever we plan a visit (usually once or twice a year). It's not fancy, but it has the "three C's" that make a Disney/Knotts-area motel a winner in my opinion: clean, comfortable, and close! The prices are consistently good, and the staff consistently friendly and helpful. Getting to Disneyland from the Travelodge is easy...you can either catch the Disney parking lot shuttle at the Travelodge, or catch a city shuttle down the block.

Summary Heading: Loved the Travelodge on Beach Blvd!
Summary: I completely agree with the last two reviews-this hotel was superb- superb customer service, superb cleanliness, superb price, and most of all superb location!!! I stayed there and talked to the new owners-they completely renovated everything and put completely different managment in place which may explain the earlier reviews. I had a great time-and recommend to any and all travelers in the LA area!

I have stayed in other Travelodge and other Hotels and this one is definitely the best hotel I ever stayed at. Rooms were well maintained and staff were very warm and helpful. I recommend this to all travelers going to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: The worst Hotel I have stayed at
Summary: This hotel was very dirty, the staff was not helpful with anything.  I complained to Travelodge Corp. and they refunded the amount of my stay even though it was a franchise location.  I have never had a problem with Travelodge Hotels and the Corp office has won my loyalty to keep staying at other Travelodge Hotels.

I booked my hotel reservation from orbitz and I was very disappointed.  The hotel was the furthest from Disneyland, not as clean, the rooms smelled of mildew.  Their pool was all of 3ft deep, their hot tub was colder then their pool.  The people in the office did not give any helpful information as to what was around and how far you would have to go to get there.  Their are several travelodge hotels in Anaheim, CA and I managed to stay at the worst one.  STAY AWAY FROM THE ONE ON BEACH BLVD.
